sentences.en: "Aubrey." Hyde seemed almost to snarl the name.
sentences.cn: “奥伯里，”海德几乎是吼出了这个名字。

sentences.en: A wary tiger flashes a toothy snarl in this extreme close - up .
sentences.cn: 一只机警的老虎在这个 特写 镜头里呲牙咆哮.

sentences.en: Ashley has gotten these accounts in an awful snarl -- Oh, that party?
sentences.cn: 艾希礼把这些帐目搞得一塌糊涂 ---- 唔, 那个宴会?

sentences.en: At the seaside we could hear the snarl of the waves.
sentences.cn: 在海滨我们可以听见波涛的咆哮.

sentences.en: His eyes flashed, and his lips were drawn back in a furious snarl.
sentences.cn: 他目光炯炯，咧开了嘴巴怒气冲冲地吼了一声。

sentences.en: His face contorted to a snarl, his hand raised to strike.
sentences.cn: 他把脸扭成一团,大声呵叱, 举起手来要打.

sentences.en: I was in the most unbelievable snarl this morning over - of all things - a truckload of insecticide!
sentences.cn: 今天早上,真想不到,为了一卡车杀虫剂的事搞得我晕头转向!

sentences.en: It can break up a bad traffic snarl.
sentences.cn: 它可以结束严重的交通混乱局面.

sentences.en: My knitting was in a terrible snarl.
sentences.cn: 我织的东西都乱成一团了.

sentences.en: She was tangled in a snarl of logs and branches.
sentences.cn: 她被困在一堆乱七八糟的木料和树枝中间。

sentences.en: The dog gave a low snarl.
sentences.cn: 这只狗发出低沉的吠声.

sentences.en: The traffic was all in a snarl near the accident.
sentences.cn: 事故发生处附近交通一片混乱.

sentences.en: To twist together or entwine into a confusing mass; snarl.
sentences.cn: 缠住卷在一起或缠卷成一大团; 卷住.

sentences.en: We heard the snarl of a dog just up the path.
sentences.cn: 我们听见狗就在路那边嗥叫.

sentences.en: You'd kinda like to see Mario's snarl over there on the bench.
sentences.cn: 你会看到板凳席上马里奥的怒吼.

words.tran_cn: 纠缠在一起的；善于嚣叫的；爱漫骂的；脾气坏的

trans.tran_cn: （动物的）龇牙低吼，愤怒叫嚷（声），咆哮（声），混乱，缠结
trans.tran_en: a vicious growl, utterance, or facial expression

trans.tran_cn: 缠结, 混乱, 吠, 咆哮, 怒骂
trans.tran_en: if an animal snarls, it makes a low angry sound and shows its teeth

trans.tran_cn: （指狗）吠，嗥叫，（人）咆哮，缠结，混乱
咆哮着说，厉声地说，搞乱，使缠结
